pages.text: And We had not sent any messengers before you, but they ate food and walked in the markets. And We have made some of you a trial for others. Will you (bear with) patience? And your Fosterer is Seeing. (R 2, P)
And those who do not hope to meet Us say, "Why have not angels been sent down on us or (why) do we not see our Fosterer?" They are indeed proud of themselves and they revolted with a great revolt
The day they will see the angels, on that day it will not be a good news for the criminals, and they will say, "(May we be) prevented (from that through some) prevention
And We will turn to the work which they did, then We will make it as scattered dust
On that day the place/time of stay of the inhabitants of the garden will be good, and their resting place the best
And on that day the sky will be split with the clouds (coverings) and the angels will be sent down, descending
The kingdom on that day, as a right, will be of the Beneficent (Allah), and the day will be difficult for the infidels
And on that day the unjust will bite his hands saying, "I wish I had taken a way with the messenger
O sorrowful is my state, I wish I had not taken such a one as a friend
he has misled me from the reminder after it had come to me, and the devil is a traitor for man
And the messenger says, "O my Fosterer ! my people have certainly taken this Quran as a forsaken thing
And thus did We make for every prophet, an enemy from among the criminals, and your Fosterer is sufficient as a Guide and a Helper
